article: I didn't have a job at the time and I was getting help from the government. One day, I was walking to a _ to get some food when I noticed a little man _ on a bench beside the store. I walked past him but could not _ thinking about him. So I _ around and went up to him and asked him if he was _ . He said no. He said he hadn't _ for two days. I told him, "Don't _ . I'll be right back." Before leaving, I _ him what he would like to eat. He said it didn't _ . Then I asked him to tell me what he hadn't had for a long _ . He said "a Pepsi". I went into the store and got him some bread, lunch meat, chips, cookies -- _ food for a few days. The store didn't have Pepsi, _ I had to go to another one. I used the _ of what I had to get him a Pepsi from a store far _ . After a long time, when I brought him the _ and the Pepsi, he cried. With _ in his eyes, he said, "You are my angel." When he stood up to hug me, I had a strange _ -- he was my angel, too. I couldn't even _ the feeling clearly. Maybe because he gave me a / an _ to help him, which helped me to understand that I also had abilities to help others.
